title: Question 10
prompt: <u>The drought lasted for three months. The orange trees did not produce oranges.</u>
description: Read the underlined sentences. Then choose the sentence that best combines those sentences into one.
feedback:
The best combination of these two sentences uses the word “because” to show the relationship between the two ideas: “The orange tress did not produce oranges because the drought lasted three months.” Since “because the drought lasted three months” is a dependent clause at the end of the sentence, no comma is needed.

This option adds unnecessary extra words and is missing commas around “so they say” and after “as a result”: “The drought so they say lasted for three months, and as a result the orange trees did not produce oranges.”

This option has an unneeded comma after “lasted” and is missing a needed comma before the coordinating conjunction “and” that joins the two sentences: “The drought lasted, for three months and as a result, the orange trees did not produce oranges.”

This option has unnecessary commas after the words “and” and “not”: “The drought lasted for three months, and, as a result, the orange trees did not, produce oranges.”
